intro: Monnina latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Monnina latifolia is drought-tolerant and is sometimes used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
